[{"topic":"1 Programming concepts","questions":[{"question":"Outline role of procedures and functions in maintainable programs.","answer":"• Procedures / functions divide the program into smaller manageable segments
• … making it more readable / easier to understand / easier to debug
• Procedures / functions with meaningful names help to provide documentation for the program / enable/help/provide abstraction

[{"question":"Write pseudocode for double entry verification check.","answer":"INPUT firstEntry
INPUT secondEntry
IF firstEntry = secondEntry THEN
  OUTPUT "Accepted"
ELSE
  OUTPUT "Mismatch"
ENDIF","paper":"S25P21","topic":"1 Algorithms","tags":["pseudocode","verification"],"marks":3,"keywords":["double entry","verification","pseudocode","compare"]},{"question":"Write pseudocode to validate integer input between 1 and 100 inclusive.","answer":"REPEAT

index <- -1
FOR i <- 1 TO 100
  IF array[i] = target THEN
    index <- i
  ENDIF
NEXT i
OUTPUT index","paper":"M25P21","topic":"4 Arrays and loops","tags":["pseudocode","array","search"],"marks":3,"keywords":["array","linear search","index","loop"]},{"question":"Write an SQL query to list StudentName and Age from Students where Age >= 16 sorted by StudentName.","answer":"SELECT StudentName, Age

  OUTPUT "Please enter a name"
  INPUT Name
